title: Reset ambitions for trillion-dollar tech future by 2035, Goyal tells industry
snippet: Minister Piyush Goyal has challenged India’s tech industry to reach a $1 trillion valuation by 2035 by prioritizing AI, data centres, and clean energy.

title: Infinix Note Edge to launch in India on 18 February: Check expected price, specs and more
snippet: Infinix will launch the Note Edge on 18 February, featuring a 1.5K curved AMOLED display, MediaTek Dimensity 7100 processor, and up to 8GB RAM. It has a 6,500 mAh battery, 50MP camera, and IP65 rating.

title: AI Impact Summit 2026: Full schedule, dates, agenda, list of global CEOs attending, and more
snippet: The AI Impact Summit 2026 is scheduled for February 16-20 in New Delhi, bringing together top AI leaders including Sundar Pichai and Bill Gates. The summit focuses on inclusive AI development and features over 700 sessions on various AI-related topics.

title: X Product Head says AI agents will make phone calls and email ‘unusable’ in 3 months: here's why
snippet: X Product Head Nikita Bier predicts that there will be a surge in spam calls and messages within 90 days, making platforms like Gmail and iMessage unusable. He attributes this to the ease of creating sophisticated scam bots using tools like OpenClaw.

title: Portugal approves restrictions on social media access for children
snippet: Portugal's parliament on Thursday ​approved a bill, on its first reading, requiring explicit ​parental consent for children aged 13 to 16 to access social media, in one of the first concrete legislative moves in Europe to impose such restrictions.

title: CCI slaps Rs 27 crore fine on tech major Intel for unfair biz practices
snippet: The Competition Commission has imposed a fine of Rs 27.38 crore on Intel Corp for indulging in anti-competitive practices with respect to India-specific warranty policy for its boxed microprocessors. The penalty has been imposed on the company for abusing its dominant position in the market for Boxe

title: Hot bots: AI agents create surprise dating accounts for humans
snippet: Computer science student Jack Luo discovers his OpenClaw AI agent created a dating profile on MoltMatch without consent. As AI agents flirt autonomously, fake profiles and stolen photos emerge, raising cybersecurity, ethical and accountability concerns about outsourcing romance to machines.

title: US' real estate stocks sink as worries about AI risks spread across Wall Street
snippet: Shares of CBRE Group, a major commercial real estate services company, fell 8.8%, bringing the two-day decline to 20% in the worst such move since 2020. Jones Lang LaSalle fell 7.6% Thursday, Cushman & Wakefield dropped 12% and Newmark Group slid 4.2%.

title: Google targeted by EU over its search advertising auction practices
snippet: The ​European Commission ⁠said it ‌has ​indications ​of potential ⁠concerns regarding the auctions for ​the sale of ​advertising on Google Search, "in particular, the way in ‌which Google has been ​artificially ​increasing ⁠the clearing price of such auctions to the ​detriment of advertisers".

title: Anthropic puts $20 million into a super PAC operation to counter OpenAI
snippet: Anthropic, the safety-focused AI company formed by former OpenAI executives, said Thursday that it was putting $20 million into a new super PAC operation that will be in opposition to super PACs backed by OpenAI's leaders and investors.

title: UN approves 40-member scientific panel on the impact of artificial intelligence over US objections
snippet: The UN General Assembly voted overwhelmingly Thursday to approve a 40-member global scientific panel on the impacts and risks of artificial intelligence, with the United States strongly objecting.

title: Pinterest forecasts downbeat revenue as it battles for digital ad dollars; shares plunge
snippet: Pinterest forecast first-quarter revenue below Wall ​Street estimates on Thursday, as it ​battles sharper cutbacks in ad spending by tariff-hit retailers and ​mounting pressure from deep-pocketed rivals, knocking its shares down more than 18% in extended trading.

snippet: Electric vehicles could be economically competitive in Africa sooner than expected.
